channel.title: Cannot enable repository
channel.description:
I tried doing
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix-APT-Repository
In terminal because I can't use the GUI because of freezing.
sudo whonix_repository returns ERROR: --repository must be either stable, stable-proposed-updates, testers or developers
EDIT: I tried sudo whonix_repository --enable --repository stable which seemed to work. But now when I run an update, I get error messages about packages not being the size reported by the server.
2nd EDIT: I just got the same error in the workstation, so it doesn't seem like it has anything to do with the original problem in the gateway... Should I be worried about these errors?

item.title: Cannot enable repository
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Size of file dists_jessie_main_binary-amd64_Packages.gz is not what the server reported Support
problems when you upgrade. what it means and how to fix? :... is not what the server reported

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot enable repository
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
whtest4321:

Should I be worried about these errors?

No, as per:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#Am_I_compromised.3F

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot enable repository
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
It means you should add for example

--repository stable

See also the man page:

man whonix_repository

Full example.

sudo whonix_repository --enable --repository stable

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot enable repository
item.dc:creator: whtest4321
item.description:
I tried doing

Whonix

Whonix-APT-Repository

Whonix stable / testers / developers APT Repository. How to change from one suite to another? How to disable Whonix's APT Repository?

In terminal because I can’t use the GUI because of freezing.

sudo whonix_repository
returns
ERROR: --repository must be either stable, stable-proposed-updates, testers or developers

EDIT: I tried
sudo whonix_repository --enable --repository stable
which seemed to work. But now when I run an update, I get error messages about packages not being the size reported by the server.

2nd EDIT: I just got the same error in the workstation, so it doesn’t seem like it has anything to do with the original problem in the gateway… Should I be worried about these errors?

Read full topic
